alert.note: Alert for San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 9:56PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern San Mateo and southeastern San Francisco Counties through 1030 PM PST... At 956 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over San Mateo, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... San Francisco, Daly City, San Mateo, Redwood City, South San Francisco, San Bruno, Pacifica, Foster City, Burlingame, San Carlos, Belmont, Millbrae, Half Moon Bay, Hillsborough, Highlands-Baywood Park, El Granada, Brisbane, Colma, Moss Beach and Montara. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast
